text:
Money Cheap high back booster seats under £35 that will keep your child safe under the new laws, plus get 20% off at Halfords Confused about the new child car seat laws and regulations? High street retailer rolls out safety campaign to help parents Share To try demystify the changes, Halfords has launched its Safer Seat campaign (Photo: Getty) Share Get money updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
To improve children's safety, from March 1st, car seat regulations are changing. 
You can read our complete break down of the new car seat rules here , but to put it simply - the new laws aim to improve kids' safety by stopping manufacturers introducing new backless booster seats for children who are smaller than a certain size. 
Still confused? You're not alone. Halfords found that 65 percent of parents found the new rules puzzling while 86 percent aren't sure what exactly the changes mean for them. 
To try demystify the changes, Halfords has launched its Safer Seat campaign, giving parents 20% off any new high back booster seat when they trade in their old booster cushions. 
To claim the discount, all you have to do is place your click & collect order for your new high back booster, using the code saferseat at the checkout. Just take your old cushion booster with you when you go to pick it up and you'll qualify for the discount. Read More Child booster seat law change: Here's everything you need to know about the new regulations Baby boy strapped into his car seat on a journey (Photo: Getty) 
Like many retailers, Halfords are also happy to provide in-store fitting demonstrations as well as advising you on what is the most appropriate seat for your child. 
They will also be putting height charts and scales in store, plus copies of the guidelines, to help parents choose the right seat for their child. 
Think! found that in 2014, 80 children aged 0-4 were seriously injured as car passengers, accounting for 28% of road casualties for this age group.
